title: Sample (statistics)
summary: In statistics and quantitative research methodology, a sample is a set of individuals or objects collected or selected from a statistical population by a defined procedure.[1] The elements of a sample are known as sample points, sampling units or observations. When conceived as a data set, a sample is often denoted by capital roman letters such X {\displaystyle X} and Y {\displaystyle Y} , with its elements expressed in lower-case (e.g., x 3 {\displaystyle x_{3}} ) and the sample size denoted by the letter n {\displaystyle n} .[2]
